concise_definition: adj. 不幸的, 不妙的, 令人遗憾的

definitions.explanation_en: Bringing or involving bad luck, misfortune, or undesirable outcomes; often used to express regret or sympathy about a situation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 带来或涉及不幸、厄运或不理想结果的；常用于表达对某种情况的遗憾或同情。
definitions.example_en: It was an unfortunate accident that left several people injured.
definitions.example_cn: 这是一场不幸的事故，导致数人受伤。

definitions.explanation_en: Unfavorable or unsuitable in a particular context; used to describe something that is inconvenient, inappropriate, or poorly timed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在特定情境下不利或不合适的；用于描述某事令人不便、不恰当或时机不佳。
definitions.example_en: The meeting was scheduled at an unfortunate time, right before the holiday.
definitions.example_cn: 会议安排在一个不巧的时间，正好在假期前。

definitions.explanation_en: Expressing a sense of disappointment or regret, often used as a polite or euphemistic way to describe something negative.
definitions.explanation_cn: 表达失望或遗憾之情，常作为委婉语来描述负面情况。
definitions.example_en: Unfortunately, we won't be able to attend the wedding.
definitions.example_cn: 很遗憾，我们无法参加婚礼了。

comparison.analysis: “Unlucky” (倒霉的) 更侧重于因运气不佳而导致的负面结果，通常用于个人遭遇或偶然事件，带有较强的宿命感。而 “unfortunate” 范围更广，可指任何不理想的情况，包括人为安排或系统性问题，语气更正式、更中性。
“Regrettable” (令人遗憾的) 强调因某事违背道德、规范或期望而引发的懊悔或内疚感，常用于责任归属明确的场合。而 “unfortunate” 更侧重于结果的不幸性，不一定涉及过错或责任，情感色彩更淡。
“Disastrous” (灾难性的) 描述的是极端严重的负面后果，具有毁灭性或不可挽回的性质。而 “unfortunate” 通常指程度较轻、尚可补救的不幸事件，语气远不如 “disastrous” 强烈。
